name: New York State Department of Labor

documents.title: Unemployment Insurance Filing Guide
documents.summary: Step-by-step guide to filing for unemployment insurance benefits in New York.
documents.content:
FILING FOR UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE:

ONLINE FILING (Fastest):
1. Visit labor.ny.gov
2. Create or sign in to your NY.gov ID account
3. Complete the unemployment application
4. Have ready:
   - Social Security number
   - Driver license or ID number
   - Last employer's information (name, address, phone)
   - Work history for past 18 months
   - Alien Registration number (if not US citizen)

BY PHONE:
Call 1-888-209-8124
- Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
- Expect longer wait times

WEEKLY CERTIFICATION:
- You MUST certify every week to receive benefits
- Certify online or by phone
- Report any earnings
- Document your work search activities

PAYMENT METHODS:
- Direct deposit (recommended)
- Debit card
- Allow 2-3 business days for payment

documents.title: Unemployment Eligibility Requirements
documents.summary: Eligibility requirements for receiving unemployment benefits in New York.
documents.content:
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS:

You may be eligible for unemployment if you:
1. Lost your job through no fault of your own
2. Earned enough wages during the base period
3. Are ready, willing, and able to work
4. Are actively searching for work

BASE PERIOD:
- Usually the first 4 of the last 5 completed calendar quarters
- Must have earned at least $3,600 in one quarter
- Must have total base period wages of 1.5x highest quarter

WEEKLY BENEFIT AMOUNT:
- Based on your highest quarter earnings
- Maximum weekly benefit: $504 (2026)
- Minimum weekly benefit: $104
- Benefits last up to 26 weeks

DISQUALIFICATIONS:
- Quit without good cause
- Fired for misconduct
- Refused suitable work
- Making false statements
- Not available for work

APPEALS:
- You can appeal any determination
- File appeal within 30 days
- Request a hearing online or by mail

documents.title: Paid Family Leave
documents.summary: Information about New York's Paid Family Leave program.
documents.content:
PAID FAMILY LEAVE (PFL):

COVERAGE:
- Bond with new child (birth, adoption, foster)
- Care for family member with serious health condition
- Assist with family obligations when family member deployed abroad

2026 BENEFITS:
- Up to 12 weeks of leave
- 67% of your average weekly wage
- Maximum weekly benefit: $1,151.16
- Job protection guaranteed

ELIGIBILITY:
- Work for covered employer
- Regular schedule: 26+ weeks at employer
- Part-time: 175+ days worked

HOW TO APPLY:
1. Notify your employer at least 30 days in advance
2. Complete PFL-1 form
3. Submit to your employer's insurance carrier
4. Provide supporting documentation

PFL vs FMLA:
- PFL provides paid leave; FMLA is unpaid
- PFL covers more family relationships
- Can use both if eligible
